Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Implausible \Im*plau"si*ble\, a. [Pref. im- not + plausible: cf. F. implausible.] Not plausible; not wearing the appearance of truth or credibility, and not likely to be believed. ``Implausible harangues.'' --Swift. -- {Im*plau"si*ble*ness}, n. -- {Im*plau"si*bly}, adv. [1913 Webster]

implausible adj 1: having a quality that provokes disbelief; "gave the teacher an implausible excuse" [ant: {plausible}] 2: highly imaginative but unlikely; "a farfetched excuse"; "an implausible explanation" [syn: {farfetched}]
